sentences.english: Immersed in a world fascinated by bass.
sentences.chinese: 沉浸在重低音的世界裏迷醉。

sentences.english: But Murphy refuses to get carried away by the prospect of Youth Cup glory.
sentences.chinese: 但是墨菲拒絕迷醉於青年足總盃的榮譽。

sentences.english: The media were drunk on easy money.
sentences.chinese: 媒體在輕而易舉得來的錢中迷醉。

sentences.english: Each sentiment very is all beautiful, each regulation accompanying also all makes one be enchanted by.
sentences.chinese: 每一份感情都很美，每一程相伴也都令人迷醉。

sentences.english: During Wei and Jin Dynasties, the Goddess Luo became an image of goddess fascinated by a variety of artists.
sentences.chinese: 魏晉之間，洛神成爲一個令各類藝術迷醉的女神形象。
她優美的聲音迷醉了每個人。
自然的氣息讓我迷醉癡狂。

sentences.english: He lifted his head into the light, at a moment of extreme ecstasy.
sentences.chinese: 在光柱中他擡起了頭，處於極度的迷醉中。

definition: to be infatuated with/to be drunk with/to be enchanted with/to revel in
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
one's thoughts fly to a longed-for place or person/to long for/infatuated/fascinated
lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth/also written 如癡如醉|如痴如醉[ru2 chi1 ru2 zui4]
